poem:
"Dialogue in the Gilded Hall"

Two wars echoing in Bavarian splendour, 
Voices hushed beneath crystal chandeliers.
Fervent whispers of hostage plight,
A ballet of diplomacy in twilight light. 
In the East, the bear prowls, teeth bared,
A Ukraine dreams of mended despair.
Their problems - perpetually spun, threadbare. 
Yet with hope emerge, even from the gloom of war,
Conversations in the gilded hall, always ask - no more?
